intro: Onosma nangqenensis, commonly known as the Nangqen onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
